overview.summary: A full-stack Django e-commerce application built as a freelance-style upgrade of a ceramic artist’s portfolio site, deployed on Render with cloud-based storage and database services.
overview.problem: The original site functioned only as a static portfolio and lacked product management, payments, persistent data storage, and scalable media handling.
overview.solution: A complete Django-based e-commerce experience with product collections, Stripe Checkout integration, cloud-hosted PostgreSQL for structured data, and AWS S3 for scalable image storage.

responsibilities: Planned and implemented the full-stack architecture based on a simulated client brief
Built Django models for products, collections, and contact submissions
Integrated Stripe Checkout for secure payment processing in test mode
Configured AWS S3 for handling product image uploads and media storage
Set up PostgreSQL as the primary database for production deployment on Render
Developed accessible, responsive templates using Django and Tailwind CSS

architecture.approach: Modular Django application with clear separation between models, views, templates, and configuration, designed to reflect real-world freelance delivery and production constraints.
architecture.data_flow: Product, collection, and contact data are persisted in a PostgreSQL database; media assets are stored in AWS S3 and served externally; Stripe handles payment flow externally while order intent is managed internally.
architecture.deployment: Deployed on Render with environment-based configuration, using PostgreSQL for production data and AWS S3 for scalable, persistent image storage.

key_features: Stripe Checkout integration for real payment flows
Cloud-based image storage using AWS S3
Accessible, semantic HTML with responsive layouts
Contact form backed by Django models and email handling
challenges_and_learnings: Designing a clean Django architecture from a client-style brief
Configuring cloud services such as AWS S3 and PostgreSQL for a production-like environment
Balancing backend logic with front-end accessibility and UX
Making practical trade-offs common in freelance projects
skills_demonstrated: Media storage and handling with AWS S3
future_improvements: Resolve authentication edge cases and improve user account flows
Optimize layouts and performance for mobile-first usage
Add persistent order history tied to authenticated users
Introduce admin-side inventory and order management tools
